abstract: Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu will travel to Washington for first meeting with Pres Obama since Congress cleared way for Iran nuclear accord; president plans to outline America's commitment to Israel's security, and discuss solutions to Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is scheduled to go to the White House on Nov. 9 to talk about the way forward now that the Iran nuclear deal has cleared obstacles in Congress.

headline.main: Obama to Host Netanyahu in First Meeting Since Nuclear Deal With Iran
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Netanyahu and Obama to Discuss Iran Deal in Meeting at the White House

snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is scheduled to go to the White House on Nov. 9 to talk about the way forward now that the Iran nuclear deal has cleared obstacles in Congress.
